revised_title: The Virulence of Desiccated Tubercular Sputum and its Relation to Temperature
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the effect of temperature on the virulence of the bacillus tuberculosis. They found that exposure to the temperature of liquid air did not destroy the virulence of the sputum, but it was possible that a higher temperature might have a modifying effect on the organism. The author also observed that 80% of the experimental animals were affected by tuberculosis, with the respiratory system being the most affected organ.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Infectious Diseases
